This game is FPS at its best! No matter how many times you play it, you'll either crap your pants or have your mind explode out of the sheer awesomeness of this game!! Incredible puzzles, frightful and disgusting enemies, superb dialogue, and best of all a gun like no other that allows you to turn every day items to super destructive items of terror.

Despite being released in 2004 HL2 is still a very pretty game, especially with modern graphics mods like MMod.
Yeah sure Valve was exited about the new physics engine and [u]maybe[/u] added a physics puzzle or 2 too many but I never felt like that took away from the core game experience.
This game is a must play in my book tbh, and this game is also fun to experience with friends in Synergy.

Basicamente el mejor puto shooter de la decada pasada, el mejor juego de Valve, ganador del premio British Academy Games Awards y el nombre "Juego de la decada" y fue la primera vez que vimos el motor Source en accion. No hay nada que no me guste de este juego, buena historia y narrativa, controles, accion y musica. El unico punto negativo es la mala IA que tiene, pero por los aÃ±os que tiene se le perdona.
Playing this game is literally irritating yourself for no significant reason cos there are no maps and a few important expected data. It's free though, worth spending time... Yet hardly.

ÐžÑ‚Ð»Ð¸Ñ‡Ð½Ð°Ñ Ð¸Ð³Ñ€Ð°. ÐŸÑ€Ð¸ Ð¿Ð¾Ð²Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€Ð½Ð¾Ð¼ Ð¿Ñ€Ð¾Ñ…Ð¾Ð¶Ð´ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ð¸ Ð½Ð°Ð¿Ñ€ÑÐ³Ð°ÑŽÑ‚ ÐºÐ°Ñ‚ÑÑ†ÐµÐ½Ñ‹, Ð½Ð¾ ÐµÑÐ»Ð¸ Ð¿Ð¾ÑÑ‚Ð°Ð²Ð¸Ñ‚ÑŒ MMod, Ñ‚Ð¾ Ð´Ð°Ð¶Ðµ ÑÐ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚Ñ 15 Ð»ÐµÑ‚ Ð¸Ð³Ñ€Ð°ÐµÑ‚ÑÑ ÑÐ²ÐµÐ¶Ð¾.

Ever since I played the first Half-Life, I always wanted to get the taste of it's sequel. It awakens you from your stasis, where the story unfolds from there.
The soundtrack is well done by the great Kelly Bailey, no point of mistaking the soundscape. Some pieces give the feelings of combat, but others ramp up an empty tension inside.
And the physics? It's really spot on with the Source Engine. You can pick up stuff, but with the Gravity Gun? You can do a lot more.
I'd recommend this game to anyone who is a Half-Life fan, but whether they should play HL1 first or not is beyond me.
